X.ii.6.A.1.c
.
Presuming Competency
In the absence of clear and convincing evidence to the contrary, presume that a person is competent.
References
:Â  For more information on
presuming competency, see
38 CFR 3.353(d)
, and
handling judicial findings related to competency, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.A.5.b
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 6, Section A - Evaluating and Rating Competency
citation: Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 6, Section A
